data.title: Rimshot-Locs Tension Rod Locks - 10 pack - 1/2 Shoulder
meta_keywords: Rimshot-Locs Tension Rod Locks - 10 pack - 1/2 Shoulder
data.meta_description: Only at Sweetwater! ✅  Easy Payments and ✅  FREE Shipping for your Rimshot-Locs Tension Rod Locks 10 pack 1/2 Shoulder!
data.text:
Keep Your Drums from Going Flat

Chronic rimshotter? Heavy hitter? If you're tired of your snare, toms, and kick drum de-tuning through heavy use and abuse, then Rimshot-Locs are for you. These steel tension rod locks are quick to install and built to last a lifetime. Just tune your drum to its desired tension, apply counterpressure with Rimshot-Locs, and that's it — your tuning stays rock solid, and you're free to hit as hard you like. This is especially critical in a recording environment, where a de-tuned snare can not only mean the difference between a seamless drum comp and an obvious one, but can render your EQ and processing work ineffective.

Note: Smaller drums with triple-flanged hoops and shorter, unthreaded shoulders will generally use RSL-Mini. Larger toms and bass drums with deep die-cast hoops or long tension rod shoulders will generally use RSL-1 for shoulders up to 1⁄2" in length; RSL-2 works for shoulders up to 3⁄4" in length.

Why Rimshot-Locs?

There are dozens of drum tension stabilizers on the market today. What Sweetwater likes about Rimshot-Locs are their rugged craftsmanship, clever engineering, and proven design. Stabler tuning means less time spent tuning up between songs, and none of the rattling, splatting, and head breakage you get from flattening. Even better, Rimshot-Locs release without special tools — just de-tune to release the locks, tune up to your desired pitch, and re-tighten Rimshot-Locs to enjoy the same rock-solid tuning stability.

What Makes Our Sales Engineers Great?

Sweetwater Sales Engineers are a world-class team of experts dedicated to you. Hand selected from across the globe, each brings a wealth of experience and expertise in the world of music gear to provide you with unparalleled service completely free of charge. Friendly relationships, real trust, and the right gear are only a call or a click away!

Sweetwater Sales Engineers attend Sweetwater University, an incredibly immersive, 13-week training program run by over 80 industry leaders and Sweetwater leadership.

Weekly Sales Meetings and Lunch & Learn chats with music industry experts ensure that Sales Engineers continuously expand their knowledge.

Many brand representatives have on-site offices, providing Sales Engineers with unprecedented access to the latest products, demos, and knowledge databases

Sweetwater Sales Engineers live and breathe gear and are as passionate about music as they are about helping you! Many have owned studios, worked as engineers, and performed as professional musicians on tours. Whether you are a beginner or an expert, your friendly Sales Engineer is professional, highly trained, and here to help you find the right gear.

Sweetwater Sales Engineers provide personalized customer service and will always recommend the right piece of gear based on your unique setup, goals, and budget. Your Sales Engineer is a committed partner in your musical journey and acts as your backstage pass to new and noteworthy gear.
